item.title: The U.S. weekly initial jobless claims have decreased, indicating a low level of layoffs.
item.description: August 14th: In the context of low layoffs in the United States last week, the initial jobless claims witnessed a slight decline. Nevertheless, due to weak domestic demand, companies are reluctant to enhance hiring, which may lead the unemployment rate to reach 4.3% in August. The U.S. Department of Labor announced on Thursday that the number of initial jobless claims for the week ending August 9 decreased by 3,000, reaching a seasonally adjusted 224,000. Currently, the U.S. labor market is showing a divergence with few layoffs and weak recruitment.Over the past three months, the average monthly increase in jobs in the United States has only been 35,000, and domestic demand experienced its slowest growth since the fourth quarter of 2022. Lou Crandall, the Chief Analyst at Wrightson ICAP, stated, "If viewed in isolation, these (initial jobless claims) data would imply that the labor market remains strong. However, we are more concerned about the soft trend in employment data over the

item.title: U.S. July PPI Growth Reaches Highest Level in Three Years
item.description: On August 14th, due to the surge in service costs, the U.S. Producer Price Index (PPI) in July reached the highest level in three years. A report issued by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics on Thursday indicated that the PPI rose by 0.9% compared to the previous month, following no change in June. The index increased by 3.3% from a year earlier. The index excluding food, energy, and trade services rose by 0.6% from June and went up by 2.8% from a year earlier. (FX678)

item.title: Analyst: Binance Experiences Brief Discrepancy Between Multiple Trading Pair Orderbook Prices and Mark Prices
item.description: On August 14th, according to on-chain analyst Ai Auntie (@ai_9684 xtpa), it is conceivable that due to a brief downturn in the cryptocurrency market, there was an excessive amount of orders within a short span of time, resulting in temporary price differences between the order book price and the mark price on several trading pairs on Binance.

item.title: A whale holding INSP has a position of 109.56 million tokens, representing 10.96% of the total supply.
item.description: On August 14th, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, a whale (0x436F and 0x2DDf) persists in accumulating INSP. Currently, it holds 109.56 million INSP (equivalent to 3.98 million US dollars), accounting for 10.96% of the total supply.

item.title: Whale (0x436F and 0x2DDf) keeps accumulating $INSP and currently holds $109.56M $INSP($3.98M), 10.96% of the total supply.
item.description: Whale (0x436F and 0x2DDf) keeps accumulating $INSP and currently holds $109.56M $INSP($3.98M), 10.96% of the total supply.

item.title: 「Brother Bigshot」 Huang Licheng liquidated his HYPE long position 1 hour ago, and his ETH long position is now facing a floating loss of $1,824,000.
item.description: On August 14th, according to on-chain analyst Ai Auntie (@ai_9684xtpa), "Brother Whale" Huang Licheng liquidated his long position in HYPE an hour ago. However, a brief drop in the ETH price has led to his 25x leveraged long position now incurring a loss of $1.824 million.

item.title: DDC Enterprise increased its BTC holdings by 120 coins, bringing the total holdings to 488 coins.
item.description: On August 14th, the New York Stock Exchange-listed company DDC Enterprise announced that it has increased its holdings by 120 BTC. The average purchase cost per BTC is $98,737. As of now, the company's total Bitcoin holdings have reached 488 BTC.

item.title: CertiK: Trading Platform BtcTurk Experiences Over $50 Million Suspicious Withdrawal
item.description: On August 14th, as per the monitoring of CertiK Alert, a suspicious withdrawal occurred on the BtcTurk exchange. More than $50 million was withdrawn from 3 wallets.

item.title: LookOnChain: Ethereum Drops Below $4600
item.description: On August 14th, according to HTX market data, Ethereum dropped below $4600, experiencing a 24-hour loss of 4.2%.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Falls Below $18,000
item.description: On August 14th, according to HTX market data, Bitcoin fell below $118,000, with a 24-hour decline of 2.2%.
